title: "Orianna has no counters" -Apdo (reposted from reddit)
body:
Other people that I hated facing off against were those who had really low lp (around 300~400 in master tier) but played champions that wouldn’t lose the laning phase. It’s difficult to win against people who play champions like Syndra, Taliyah, and Orianna. Yeah, I’d usually farm more cs than the enemy laner. But those champions are impossible to crush.

Orianna’s counter? Orianna doesn’t have a counter.There are no champions that can defeat Orianna in the mid lane.



https://www.reddit.com/r/leagueoflegends/comments/6nmbjk/even_apdo_admits_that_orianna_has_no_counters/?st=j57478ek&sh=6691f103

https://www.reddit.com/r/leagueoflegends/comments/6nmbjk/even_apdo_admits_that_orianna_has_no_counters/?st=j57478ek&sh=6691f103

Cx orianna takes skill btw.

replies.body:
apparently some silver players on the comments know better than the top 1 challenger ever seen in china- korea
LEGIT AF

You say this, but I've said the EXACT same thing in recent weeks and got mocked and downvoted for "being silver" and not knowing what I was talking about (by higher ranked players I'll point out). Apdo says the exact same thing I said (different wording but exact same point I made), and suddenly D sucking as if some of these same people I'm seeing in this thread weren't mocking me for it like 2-3 weeks ago.

That's because people want to defend their overloaded champ. Its not your fault, its just people being defensive.

A pro saying it just gives a very strong perspective on a case that often can't be denied.

> [{quoted}](name=WoonStruck,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=7gjZIN5B,comment-id=000200000001,timestamp=2017-07-17T02:37:52.020+0000)
>
> That's because people want to defend their overloaded champ. Its not your fault, its just people being defensive.
> 
> A pro saying it just gives a very strong perspective on a case that often can't be denied.

Said pro ain't saying she's broken or overloaded. Just that she's safe and doesn't have bad matchups. 

Which is false anyways. Any pro worth their salt knows longer ranged mages beat her. Unfortunately, those mages aren't doing so hot right now. Also, Lucian and Cait can run circles around Orianna.

Okay, give me an example of a generalist champion that has no bad match-ups that hasn't been considered overpowered before. Specifically for being generalist. 

I'll wait.

> [{quoted}](name=WoonStruck,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=7gjZIN5B,comment-id=00020000000100000000,timestamp=2017-07-17T03:03:44.330+0000)
>
> Okay, give me an example of a generalist champion that has no bad match-ups that hasn't been considered overpowered before. Specifically for being generalist. 
> 
> I'll wait.

Rather loaded question, considering anything was considered OP either due to A) Rito nerfing a ton of people which caused a trickle effect B) Buffing stupidly C) Introducing broken items D) Aren't many generalists to begin with 

But if you want one, Old Karma. She had no bad matchups in lane and only was mana hangry. Never considered OP at all, being a hybrid type or what you call a 'generalist' nowadays.

> [{quoted}](name=ZapMyHeart,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=7gjZIN5B,comment-id=000200000001000000000001,timestamp=2017-07-17T05:51:09.355+0000)
>
> 
> But if you want one, Old Karma. 

wonder why she isn't in the game anymore
{{champion:57}} pre rework

Do you even know how many times he was considered overpowered and nerfed? Lol

It came to the point where they reworked him because he was either the best champion or a nonfactor.

She does, actually. When I was playing Lux mid, I was very frustrated that I could never decisively win lane against an Orianna. I saw many, many complaints about how OP she is, so I decided to give her a try.

Several games later, I've come to realize that she _does_ need skill to play. She's probably mid-range in skill, but that's nothing to scoff at.

Sure, she doesn't have a "counter" who can consistently win lane 7/0 in 15 minutes, but outfarming and roaming is effective against her.

Just because 1 high elo person says a champion is overpowered, doesn't mean he/she/it is.

If you put more time into learning how to beat her without worrying about getting tons of kills, you might get somewhere. She's just not a champion who dies in lane. There are others who are similar in that respect, so I don't see how it's a problem at all.
If Apdo says it, its prolly right. but ori is my balanced waifu hehe
Unless Faker says it, I'm not going to take the word of any individual player.

> [{quoted}](name=Killed Inaction,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=7gjZIN5B,comment-id=000000000000,timestamp=2017-07-16T20:30:35.140+0000)
>
> Unless Faker says it, I'm not going to take the word of any individual player.

do you even know who Apdo is..?
He also said Yasuo is flat broken, but I don't see threads about that :^)

> [{quoted}](name=WalkingInACircle,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=7gjZIN5B,comment-id=00000000000000000000,timestamp=2017-07-16T22:23:57.572+0000)
>
> He also said Yasuo is flat broken, but I don't see threads about that :^)

The boards were absolutely flooded with it at the time. 

He also said that new Ryze was trash. You know, the one Riot had to completely gut in order to get it out of pro play.

> [{quoted}](name=DunkinNoobs,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=7gjZIN5B,comment-id=000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2017-07-16T23:06:39.525+0000)
>
> The boards were absolutely flooded with it at the time. 
> 
> He also said that new Ryze was trash. You know, the one Riot had to completely gut in order to get it out of pro play.

because hes a soloq player. Ryze is always broken in competitive and shit in soloq

Ryze isn't even a contested pick in competitive play.

http://imgur.com/A6AScA7

Those are Ryze's recent games. Look at that KDA.
Ryze hasn't been a hot pick except for a one month period earlier this year. He was absolutely busted in Season 5, but since then he's been underperforming. He's had consistently well below 50% win rate for over 2 years, just nearly touching 50% in early Season 5.

Though maybe Exileh just sucks.

> [{quoted}](name=Danjeng,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=7gjZIN5B,comment-id=00000000000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2017-07-17T01:53:14.656+0000)
>
> Ryze isn't even a contested pick in competitive play.
> 
> http://imgur.com/A6AScA7
> 
> Those are Ryze's recent games. Look at that KDA.
> Ryze hasn't been a hot pick except for a one month period earlier this year. He was absolutely busted in Season 5, but since then he's been underperforming. He's had consistently well below 50% win rate for over 2 years, just nearly touching 50% in early Season 5.
> 
> Though maybe Exileh just sucks.

Sorry i should have clarified. Ryze used to be busted in competitive.
If its about solo q, Apdo probably > Faker tho
I legit have rarely played her and I can play her at basically a diamond level.  She is actually brain dead if you are decent.

Well, she wouldn't show anything on an EEG, sure, given that she's clockwork. So, I guess you're right, she's technically brain dead.

"Diamond level" in ARAM. Right. That's really impressive. If she's so broken, why not play her in ranked? Maybe you can get that 13% win rate you've got going lately up, yeah? Should be pretty easy since she's so OP and easy to play.

Yeah I will.  Sadly trying to pick up Zed again has brought my lp a bit too low.  I should just stop trying to play a fun but hard champ and cash in on some freelo.  Ive been playing her on my smurf though 80% wr out of 5 games with like a 12 kda.  Sadly its just low plat mmr rn.

A smurf isn't a good way to determine whether something's overpowered or not. If you name a champion, I can go onto my smurf and get a high win rate and KDA on that champion with no effort.

I don't understand why Orianna gets so much hate. I've never had a huge problem with her overall, and watching the LCS, it's pretty easy to see that she's fairly well balanced for competitive play as well. My guess is that people don't bother learning how the champion works, and don't put effort into keeping track of her ball, and just complain that what they don't understand is broken. A magic trick seems to break the laws of physics until you take the time to learn how it works.

If you look at Apdo's quote again, he says
1. He can CS more than enemy Oriannas, Taliyahs, and Syndras.
2. His only problem with those champions is that he can't just stomp the lane (and _not losing_ lane is what those champions are literally all about).
3. There are no champions that can _defeat_ Orianna mid lane. That doesn't mean you can't win against her late-game. It doesn't mean you can't outfarm. It doesn't mean you can't roam. Just that you won't defeat her in laning phase, meaning getting kills and/or taking the turret in lane phase.

And lastly, maybe you should either A) put time into getting better at the champion before heading straight into ranked with him, or B) find a champion you _can_ play well already who is also fun.

Well first off I have been playing Zed since I started the game.  Ive climbed as high as diamond 3 with him, but Zed has been complete trash lately (until this patch), so I have been playing more normals with friends and a lot less ranked.  Sadly with a big break comes a big dip in skill.  And personally I'm willing to go from d3 to plat to relearn Zed. 

And second he said it is difficult to win against players who play shit like Ori, Syndra and Tali because it is way too hard to kill/ make them irrelevant.  Read what you are typing, the best mid laner in the world cant beat Ori's in lane because the champion is too hard to do anything to in lane.  He is a better player by a large margin, but he cant pressure them because they picked a champion.  It literally screams "Hey I'm not anywhere near your skill but Ill pick this and just go even with you because skill cx." And if he wasn't such a good player he would just straight up lose.  Remind me how that is ok?

Except Apdo didn't say she's overpowered. He said there's no counter to her that can stomp her in lane. Two very different things. She's not overpowered, just a safe pick, as ZapMyHeart above just said.

I don't think I'm any better of a player than most of the Oriannas I fought while I was still trying to move to Lux mid from support, and even though I was very uncomfortable in the mid lane, I rarely lost lane.

Here's the thing: Orianna is a _safe_ pick. She's not going to win lane in most cases, if the player is of lesser or equal skill. She just doesn't lose lane. That's what the champion is about. Why wouldn't he take Orianna mid if it's "overpowered"? Because it's almost impossible to _win_ the lane as Orianna, just as it's not very hard to _not lose_ lane as her, against a similarly skilled opponent, or even one of lesser/greater skill.

Again, she's not overpowered, and Apdo never said she was. He said it's difficult to win _lane phase_ against her. The (second) best mid laner in the world can't win lane against a safe pick by someone who's Master tier with 400 LP. I don't see a problem with that, seeing as he _outfarms_ them.

So, yes, it is okay, because no, he wouldn't lose if he were slightly worse at the game. Even if he were much worse, and also Master tier, he very likely wouldn't _lose_ the lane.

I'll say it one more time. Orianna is a safe pick. That's why she's chosen. Not to win lane, but purely to avoid losing it.

> [{quoted}](name=Killed Inaction,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=7gjZIN5B,comment-id=00000001000000000000,timestamp=2017-07-16T20:52:57.258+0000)

> 2. His only problem with those champions is that he can't just stomp the lane (and _not losing_ lane is what those champions are literally all about).


Isn't Apdo being a salty dog then? 

He's known for trying to crush his lane enemy, but Orianna has always been a safe pick, so is there any wonder why he couldn't "stomp" the lane like he usually does then? 

I feel like this is just a trickle effect. Most mid mages outside of Syndra and Ahri aren't even worth mentioning. Orianna's counters (longer ranged mages such as Ziggs, Lux, Azir, etc) are nerfed to where they aren't even good picks in mid. So is there any reason why people are flocking to a safe pick where it wouldn't be a clown fiesta in mid lane? 

As for mana arguments, Lost Chapter needs a nerf.

But I wonder if nerfing Orianna is going to solve anything. It might make her less picked, but it doesn't fix the fact that mid mages has been slowly forced out of mid lane and into either the trash can or bot lane, leaving mid lane open for assassins, ADCs, and bruisers to take over.
bronzies in this post trying to argue against literally the worlds greatest player, who spends his entire life analyzing everything is so fucking cute.
So because _one_ guy says something you believe it's appropriate to dismiss all opposing opinions as nonsense. That's a narrow minded way of reasoning things, you know.

Everyone I talked to said they were both terrible candidates, but that there's really no chance of a third party success for a while longer at least.

Also simply saying that someone says something doesn't prove that something (even if that person seems quite knowledgable).  If you provide the evidence that person uses to back up that claim, you may have proof, but without actual evidence, it's just what someone thinks to be true.

I'm not saying that he's wrong, but being told to just blindly follow what another says doesn't sit well with me.
Her laning phase is waaay too oppressive for how good she scales. She needs a serious mana cost increase on her q.
i would say that they need to look at last chapter. it just makes it too easy for a champ to negate there intended weakness, high mana costs.

"Apdo's understanding of the game is much deeper than most people who will comment on this page. For the majority of the people who play this game orianna isnt a problem, because most people who play orianna do not have a understanding of her. When apdo says ori and syndra are unbeatable in lane. Hes not talking about the majority of syndras you see. Hes speaking about the top like .1% of people who play those champs" Just because you play Orianna, doesn't mean it's a free win. Any Diamond+ midland could dumpster Plat and below Orianna's. This is only relevant at the top level.

Is saying "Any Diamond+ midland could dumpster Plat and below Orianna's"  really an argument? That statement doesn't really have anything to do with "This is only relevant at the top level". It doesn't matter if a diamond+ midlaner can trash a lower rank midlaner. I would expect them to do that in any matchup if they belong there. The better question is whether or not Orianna has any "counters" if skill level is equal. If two midlaners that both belong in Bronze/S/G/P/D/M/C play and one picks Orianna is there a kind of matchup that Orianna is weak in? Aurelion and Vel'Koz  are very vulnerable to dives while being strong in other situations. That is the norm. 

(of course Orianna does require a fair amount of practice, so anyone that puts that work and time in to learn her properly would almost certainly be able to climb out of Bronze and Silver into gold no matter who they were playing)

If Orianna has a neutral matchup worst case scenario in any game with equal footing then she's broken/op, because even if you can make a case for her not having any strong matchups this makes her a generalist which is bad.

Sorry If I'm coming off as strong or aggressive "He's not talking about the majority of syndras you see. He's speaking about the top like .1% of people who play those champs" simply made it seem kinda like you were trivialising the problem down to say it wasn't a problem.

Not saying it's what you were doing, but I think it can be viewed that way.
Isnt Lucian mid her counter ?

Not unless he gets a double kill early. He tries to harass her, but without getting early kills he falls off much harder without doing much.

######Based on MSI and LCS observations, your matchups may vary

> [{quoted}](name=DrCyanide,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=7gjZIN5B,comment-id=00010000,timestamp=2017-07-16T19:54:39.038+0000)
>
> Not unless he gets a double kill early. He tries to harass her, but without getting early kills he falls off much harder without doing much.
> 
> ######Based on MSI and LCS observations, your matchups may vary

Well i mean, Xiye solo killed Fakers Oriana as Lucian without having early double kill and completely shut faker down that game

I'd want to see several instances of it to consider it a counter, as oppose to one off cases. From what I've seen the matchup can go both ways, with Lucian winning in early harass but Orianna winning the mid to late game.
N o p e.

I say Ori is ridiculous and has little coutner play directly, I get downvoted and mocked. Apdo says it and all you hear is D sucking noises and the clicking noises of upvotes.

I hate hate hate the word "sheep", but in this case, I gotta use it. "Yeah But you're silver, so you don't know what you're talking about". I guess if I said water was wet you guys would probably say the same.

Not having a counter usually means they don't _counter_ anyone, either. Morgana mid is almost the exact same thing. She doesn't _win_ lane against anyone, really. But she doesn't _lose_ against anyone, either.

I love when people want to go with the "but a pro said" argument when talking about anything related to league.

Then again I'm old enough to remember Doublelift saying ADC as a roll would die out.

I'm old enough to remember pros thinking Lucien was garbage until he gained steam in Korea

Honestly I'm just old enough to remember several times pros have been wrong time after time after time, and realized that like everyone else they have their own bias with which they view the game.  In this case you have an extremely aggressive midlaner who's halmark is stomping the hell out of his opponents and carrying games bitching about champions who's halmarks are being extremely safe laners who are hard to kill during the laning phase.  Gee I wonder why he could be complaining about them.

The same reason pro ADCs complain about assassins, the reason pros that favor tanks complain about ADCs, the reason assassin mains complain about champs like Janna and Lulu, I could go on.  People who favor a specific playstyle or champ bitch about champs that counter those playstyles.  

I would be willing to bet he would bitch if mid lane Morgana became a thing again, because if you think Orianna/Syndra/Tailyah are safe laners who you can't crush mid Morgana has been the poster child for safe mid laner since she was created.
Isn't Orianna vulnerable to longer ranged poke such as Xerath, Lux, Vel'Koz and Ziggs?

> [{quoted}](name=HalcyonDweller,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=7gjZIN5B,comment-id=002c,timestamp=2017-07-17T18:33:24.579+0000)
>
> Isn't Orianna vulnerable to longer ranged poke such as Xerath, Lux, Vel'Koz and Ziggs?

She is.

Or anyone with the slightest mobility.

Thought so. Although I do think she's too strong in some ways.

OP really went overboard here didn't they? I wish people wouldn't take things out of context to try to prove a point. It hurts the whole case when people pull fallacies in order to support their argument in agreement with the case.
Skill with Oriana is what makes her so strong. You can't faceroll and get the same results. I hate Oriana, but don't say she takes no skill.
{{champion:101}} {{champion:34}} {{champion:161}} {{champion:103}}{{champion:115}}
I ban Anivia every time I play ori

I Kinda have to agree but also Kinda Disagree?

Orianna is pretty damn strong and dying in lane for her will be difficult, BUT she does have some decisive Counters who can push her back, such being Zed and Ziggs, namely.

I Myself Main Zed and I have yet to lose my lanes vs any Orianna, with or without my roaming.  Sure, she can hard pressure at lvl1 and 2 due to her zoning potential, and deny farm because of her Ball being such a threat, but her weakness is instant burst with escapes. Orianna's Ball doesn't instant move, so she will have a lot of issues with Mobile enemies who can also deal a decent chunk of damage, and Zed is someone who does both in it's perfection.

Ziggs as far as I am Concerned possesses the stronger Siege Potential and Harrass Inlane, his Q's can chunk absurdly hard once you hit lvl 9 and got maybe half of your Morell done with boots, which actually is not that much AP to consider. His AoE ranges make it further difficult for Orianna because she Needs to position herself in order to possess the range for positioning her Ball, and Ziggs can deny her that Self-positioning with his W and his E, whilst harrassing her inlane with his Q and push Towers hard with his passive and his W Tower-execute.

Long Story short, Orianna is a threat, she is very strong, and she does not require an otherworldly skillcurve to Play. She is hard to master, but she is incredibly easy to pick up and make first steps with. However she has defined Counters, they are just not popular as of right now, but that does not make them non-existent.
